newsitem.title: USA: U.S., Mexico to hold satellite licensing talks.
newsitem.headline: U.S., Mexico to hold satellite licensing talks.

text.p: A Mexican delegation will meet with U.S. negotiators this week to try to hammer out a deal allowing U.S. and Mexican television satellite companies to operate in either country.
"I hope it will be the last (meeting)," Reed Hundt, chairman of the U.S. Federal Communications Commission, told reporters on Tuesday.
Hundt said the meeting was the latest in a series of negotiations to allow the licensing of television satellite services.
Ever since the two countries signed an umbrella agreement last April to regulate the service, they have been negotiating a series of protocols including one for Direct-to-Home.
The service allows subscribers to receive movies and other television programs from a direct satellite transmission, circumventing the usual cable reception.
